Constructor Detail

WinTrace

public WinTrace()
WinTrace constructor :

you can map a WinTrace to an existing window.

Nothing Is send to the viewer

WinTrace

public WinTrace(java.lang.String winTraceID,
                java.lang.String winTraceTitle)
WinTrace constructor.

The Window Trace is create on the viewer (if not already done)

Parameters:
winTraceID - Required window trace Id. If empty, a guid will be generated
winTraceTitle - The Window Title on the viewer.If empty, a default name will be used
Method Detail

setLogFile

public void setLogFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                       int mode)
Set the log file.

(Path is relative to the viewer) To enabled log on local AND on the viewer call this funtion twice. To don't use the viewer, set the TTrace.options.sendMode to SendMode.None.

Parameters:
fileName - file to save.
mode -

Local and viewer site log mode. 0, Viewer Log is disabled.

1, Viewer log enabled.

2, Viewer log enabled. A new file is create each day (CCYYMMDD is appended to the filename)

3, Local log is disabled

4, Local log enabled.

5, Local log enabled. A new file is create each day (CCYYMMDD is appended to the filename)

setLogFile

public void setLogFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                       int mode,
                       int maxLines)
Set the log file.

(Path is relative to the viewer) To enabled log on local AND on the viewer call this function twice. To don't use the viewer, set the TTrace.options.sendMode to SendMode.None.

Parameters:
fileName - file to save.
mode -

Local and viewer site log mode. 0, Viewer Log is disabled.

1, Viewer log enabled.

2, Viewer log enabled. A new file is create each day (CCYYMMDD is appended to the filename)

3, Local log is disabled

4, Local log enabled.

5, Local log enabled. A new file is create each day (CCYYMMDD is appended to the filename)

maxLines - Number of lines before starting a new file (default : -1 = unlimited)

getLocalLogFile

public java.lang.String getLocalLogFile()
Return the last local log file. (when mode 4 or 5 is used). Note : Call TTrace.Flush() to ensure traces are saved

Returns:
last local log file

public void setColumnsTitle(java.lang.String value)
set columns title

Parameters:
value - tab separated columns titles

setColumnsWidth

public void setColumnsWidth(java.lang.String widths)
set columns widths

Parameters:
widths - : Tab separated columns width.

The format for each column is width[:Min[:Max]]

where Min and Max are optional minimum and maximum column width for resizing purpose.

Example : 100:20:80 tab 200:50 tab 100

Set the focus to the next matching node

Parameters:
searForward - If true search down, else search up

gotoBookmark

public void gotoBookmark(int pos)
Set the focus to a bookmarked node identified by his position. Bookmarks are cheched by the user or with the node.SetBookmark() function

Parameters:
pos - Indice of the bookmark

public void clearBookmark()

clearFilter

public void clearFilter()
Clear all filters

addFilter

public void addFilter(int column,
                      int compare,
                      java.lang.String text)
Add a filter to node. Multiple calls to this function can be done. Call ApplyFilter() to apply filtering

Parameters:
column - column to apply filter.

In multicolumn mode the first column start at 0

In normal mode :

col icone = 999

col time = 1

col thread = 2

col traces = 3

col Comment = 4

col members = 998

compare - There is 5 kinds of filters :

Equal = 0

Not equal = 1

Contains = 2

Don't contains = 3

(Ignore this filter) = 4 or -1

text - The text to search (insensitive)

applyFilter

public void applyFilter(boolean conditionAnd,
                        boolean showMatch,
                        boolean includeChildren)
Apply filters after calls to AddFilter().

Parameters:
conditionAnd - If true, use an 'AND' condition for each filters, else use a "OR"
showMatch - If true, show node that match filter and hide others. If false hide matching node and show others
includeChildren - If true, search in subnodes

createResource

public void createResource(int resId,
                           int resType,
                           int resWidth,
                           java.lang.String resText)
Plugin API : Create a resource.

Parameters:
resId - The resource Id (must be >= 100)
resType - resource type 
      CST_RES_BUT_RIGHT     :   Button on right
      CST_RES_BUT_LEFT      :   Button on left
      CST_RES_LABEL_RIGHT   :   Label on right
      CST_RES_LABELH_RIGHT  :   Label on right HyperLink
      CST_RES_LABEL_LEFT    :   Label on left
      CST_RES_LABELH_LEFT   :   Label on left hyperlink
      CST_RES_MENU_ACTION   :   Item menu in the Actions Menu
      CST_RES_MENU_WINDOW   :   Item menu in the Windows Menu.

      Call CreateResource on the main win trace to create "Windows" menu item
resWidth - Width of the resource. Applicable only to button and labels
resText - Resource text

disableResource

public void disableResource(int resId)
Plugin API : Disable tracetool or user created resources

Parameters:
resId - The resource Id

resource id to disable. Tracetool resources :

CST_ACTION_CUT cut same as copy then delete

CST_ACTION_COPY copy

CST_ACTION_DELETE delete selected

CST_ACTION_SELECT_ALL select all

CST_ACTION_RESIZE_COLS resize columns

CST_ACTION_VIEW_INFO view trace info

CST_ACTION_VIEW_PROP view properties

CST_ACTION_PAUSE Pause

CST_ACTION_SAVE SaveToFile

CST_ACTION_CLEAR_ALL clear all

CST_ACTION_CLOSE_WIN Close win

CST_ACTION_LABEL_INFO TracesInfo label

CST_ACTION_LABEL_LOGFILE LabelLogFile label

CST_ACTION_VIEW_MAIN View Main trace

CST_ACTION_VIEW_ODS ODS

CST_ACTION_OPEN_XML XML trace -> Tracetool XML traces

CST_ACTION_EVENTLOG Event log

CST_ACTION_TAIL Tail

setTextResource

public void setTextResource(int resId,
                            java.lang.String resText)
Plugin API : Set the resource text (tracetool or user created resources), specified by his Id

Parameters:
resId - The resource Id
resText - Resource text

linkToPlugin

public void linkToPlugin(java.lang.String pluginName,
                         int flags)
Plugin API : Attach a winTrace to a plugin. Many winTrace can be attached to a plugin.

The inverse is true : a plugin don't need to be attached to a WinTrace

The plugin identified by his internal name (not dll name).

When linked, the plugin can receive event.

Parameters:
pluginName - name of the plugin
flags - combinaison of CST_PLUG_ONACTION , CST_PLUG_ONBEFOREDELETE , CST_PLUG_ONTIMER
